channel.title: Attacking error
channel.description:
Attacking Error l) OK, when I use a melee weapon and attack a player, it hits them. Then when they walk away, my character doesn't follow them and they still get damaged. My character doesn't move, and still they get damaged even if they are far away. Does anyone know how to solve this?
ll) [b]Sometimes[/b] when I click to attack somebody, it does the hitting emote but the other player doesn't get hit at all. I have to wait a few seconds then click on them again for it to attack properly. Why is this?

item.title: Attacking error
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

I applied that in playerHandler.java this is how it looks -

public void FollowPlayer(int playerID) { int follow = players[playerID].followPlayer; int playerX = server.playerHandler.players[follow].absX; int playerY = server.playerHandler.players[follow].absY; if(server.playerHandler.players[follow] != null) { if(playerY < players[playerID].absY) { players[playerID].moveX = GetMove(players[playerID].absX, playerX); players[playerID].moveY = GetMove(players[playerID].absY, playerY+1); } else if(playerY > players[playerID].absY) { players[playerID].moveX = GetMove(players[playerID].absX, playerX); players[playerID].moveY = GetMove(players[playerID].absY, playerY-1); } else if(playerX < players[playerID].absX) { players[playerID].moveX = GetMove(players[playerID].absX, playerX+1); players[playerID].moveY = GetMove(players[playerID].absY, playerY); } else if(playerX > players[playerID].absX) { players[playerID].moveX = GetMove(players[playerID].absX, playerX-1); players[playerID].moveY = GetMove(players[playerID].absY, playerY); } players[playerID].getNextplayerMovement(); players[playerID].updateRequired = true; } } public void FollowPlayerCB(int NPCID, int playerID) { int playerX = server.playerHandler.players[playerID].absX; int playerY = server.playerHandler.players[playerID].absY; if(server.playerHandler.players[playerID] != null) { if(playerY < players[playerID].absY) { players[playerID].moveX = GetMove(players[playerID].absX, playerX); players[playerID].moveY = GetMove(players[playerID].absY, playerY+1); } else if(playerY > players[playerID].absY) { players[playerID].moveX = GetMove(players[playerID].absX, playerX); players[playerID].moveY = GetMove(players[playerID].absY, playerY-1); } else if(playerX < players[playerID].absX) { players[playerID].moveX = GetMove(players[playerID].absX, playerX+1); players[playerID].moveY = GetMove(players[playerID].absY, playerY); } else if(playerX > players[playerID].absX) { players[playerID].moveX = GetMove(players[playerID].absX, playerX-1); players[playerID].moveY = GetMove(players[playerID].absY, playerY); } players[playerID].getNextplayerMovement(); players[playerID].updateRequired = true; } }

It says cannot find symbol for loads of stuff :o

Read full topic

item.title: Attacking error
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

    public void FollowAttacker(int playerID) {
        String follow = playerHandler.players[playerID].playerName;
	int playerX = playerHandler.players[playerID].absX;
	int playerY = playerHandler.players[playerID].absY;
    if(playerHandler.players[playerID] != null)
     {
      if(absY < playerHandler.players[playerID].absY) {
      npcs[NPCID].moveX = GetMove(npcs[NPCID].absX, playerX);
      npcs[NPCID].moveY = GetMove(npcs[NPCID].absY, playerY+1);
      }
      else if(absY > playerHandler.players[playerID].absY) {
      npcs[NPCID].moveX = GetMove(npcs[NPCID].absX, playerX);
      npcs[NPCID].moveY = GetMove(npcs[NPCID].absY, playerY-1);
      }
      else if(absX < playerHandler.players[playerID].absX) {
      npcs[NPCID].moveX = GetMove(npcs[NPCID].absX, playerX+1);
      npcs[NPCID].moveY = GetMove(npcs[NPCID].absY, playerY);
      }
      else if(absX > playerHandler.players[playerID].absX) {
      npcs[NPCID].moveX = GetMove(npcs[NPCID].absX, playerX-1);
      npcs[NPCID].moveY = GetMove(npcs[NPCID].absY, playerY);
      }
      npcs[NPCID].getNextNPCMovement();                                              
      playerHandler.players[playerID].updateRequired = true;
     }
    }

is something close, although i am not finished, you get my point, so, i could fix this, and maybe some poeple took the time to, but there wuold be about 2 days of work involved maybe 3 because i dotn know if they have the thing where the player can be forced to move

Read full topic

item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

for number one, you need to be a good coder like you are and get the NPC following player thing, and then make another one that applies to players

for number two, i think it has something to do with timers or just lagged and messed up timer/code
